body:
Hi @owen-synergy, adding a conda-forge recipe would be great! It's already on our list of CI/distribution issues #196. 

I've not done this before and only looked into it briefly, I'm not sure what specific architecture or special build steps would be. Most of our building process and deployment to PyPI is written in [`sktime/build_tools/`](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/tree/master/build_tools).
Hi @owen-synergy  I would like to add it but i haven't done it before, it would be great if you could help?

I followed the link as @mloning mentioned. 

One problem is that `scikit-posthocs
pmdarima` packages are not available in conda-forge which are required for sktime.  [https://conda-forge.org/docs/maintainer/knowledge_base.html#core-dependency-tree-packages-cdts](url)
[https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/issues/7462](url)
[https://github.com/facebookresearch/nevergrad/issues/272#issuecomment-530989489](url)

Still I have created a recipe [https://github.com/ketulgupta1995/staged-recipes/blob/master/recipes/sktime/meta.yaml](url) .

But it fails and it is not related to `scikit-posthocs
pmdarima` , can anyone help with this?

`["  ERROR (sktime,lib/python3.7/site-packages/sktime/classification/shapelet_based/mrseql/mrseql.cpython-37m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so): .. but ['libstdcxx-ng'] not in reqs/run, (i.e. it is overlinking) (likely) or a missing dependency (less likely)", "  ERROR (sktime,lib/python3.7/site-packages/sktime/classification/shapelet_based/mrseql/mrseql.cpython-37m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so): .. but ['libgcc-ng'] not in reqs/run, (i.e. it is overlinking) (likely) or a missing dependency (less likely)"]
`
Also the `libgcc-ng` is present in packages being installed.
I have attached the logs.
[logs.txt](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/files/4954266/logs.txt)

Thanks @ketulgupta1995, really appreciate your effort! 

Seems like the error comes from the cpp code. Perhaps you can find a solution in the [advanced installation instructions](https://sktime.org/installation.html#development-version)?

issue.title: CI/CD enhancements

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
A few useful change to improve our release/distribution cycle:

- [x] compile manylinux wheels (see #188)
- [x] set up CI to directly upload wheels to PyPI
- [x] include Makefile to automise release workflow (see this [intro](https://the-turing-way.netlify.com/make/make.html), also see e.g. https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/CleverCSV/blob/master/make_release.py)
- [x] enforce code formatting in released code (see #208, #256)
- [x] add coverage for unit tests (see #394)
- [ ] add code quality/climate checks (see https://lgtm.com, https://www.codacy.com, https://github.com/marketplace/code-climate, etc)
- [ ] consider [cibuildwheel](https://github.com/joerick/cibuildwheel/tree/master/cibuildwheel) package to simplify wheel building across platforms
- [ ] improve packaging for macOS wheels with [delocate](https://github.com/matthew-brett/delocate), also included in cibuildwheel, also see https://iscinumpy.gitlab.io/post/azure-devops-python-wheels/ 
- [x] distribute sktime via conda-forge: https://conda-forge.org/#contribute (see #326)
- [x] set up [pre-commit config](https://ljvmiranda921.github.io/notebook/2018/06/21/precommits-using-black-and-flake8/) (see #394)
- [x] add Black for code formatting (see #394)
- [x] add [check-manifest](https://pypi.org/project/check-manifest/) (see #394)
- [x] add [bugbear](https://pypi.org/project/flake8-bugbear/) to flake8 (see #394)
- [x] update setup.cfg, see e.g. https://github.com/scikit-hep/boost-histogram/blob/develop/setup.cfg (see #394)
- [ ] check out other [flake8 extensions](https://github.com/DmytroLitvinov/awesome-flake8-extensions)
- [ ] add checks for broken website links: https://fastpages.fast.ai/fastlinkcheck/
- [ ] use GitHub Action to check if Binder works and pre-build Docker images for quicker launch: https://github.com/jupyterhub/repo2docker-action#use-github-actions-to-cache-the-build-for-binderhub 
- [ ] explore [pre-commit-ci](https://pre-commit.ci) as suggested in #794 

#### Extra resources
* For building/distribution on GitHub Actions checkout: https://scikit-hep.org/developer/gha_wheels
* Useful links from [reproducible research lunch](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/the-turing-way/issues/746)  
* scikit-learn's [release process](https://scikit-learn.org/dev/developers/maintainer.html) 
* Check out https://python-poetry.org thanks to @hiqbal2
* Consider [setuptools_scm](https://github.com/pypa/setuptools_scm) for versioning (software configuration management)

issue.title: Relax `numba` pinning

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.

I'm trying to package `sktime` for `conda` but it turns out that the version of `llvmlite` required by the `numba` pinning wasn't able to be built for py38/win64.

If `sktime` doesn't strictly *require* `numba =0.50.*` then the easiest solution is to simply relax the pinning.

body:
Linking https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/13568#pullrequestreview-564010418 here. We need to add the badge to the readme once sktime is available via condo-forge. 

Thanks again @dhirschfeld for working on this!

https://github.com/conda-forge/sktime-feedstock

Not sure how far you'll get without all the deps, but it's a start. Still need to try relaxing the numpy pin & improve the CI. Will try and find some time shortly...
Also added the badge now to the README (see commit [cc5d9](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/commit/cc5d9d440824efa6c0ac41757b6e02ca115b81fd)) and we're all set!
